intro: Galium maneauense, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, white or pinkish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
